block.p: Julie Frances King and Daniel Geoff Oliver were married yesterday in Canton, Ohio. The Rev. Ronald M. Klingler performed the ceremony at St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church.
Ms. King, 34, is keeping her name. She has completed the first year of medical school at Johns Hopkins. She graduated from Northwestern University.
Julie Frances King and Daniel Geoff Oliver were married yesterday in Canton, Ohio. The Rev. Ronald M. Klingler performed the ceremony at St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church.
Julie Frances King and Daniel Geoff Oliver were married yesterday in Canton, Ohio. The Rev. Ronald M. Klingler performed the ceremony at St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church.
Ms. King, 34, is keeping her name. She has completed the first year of medical school at Johns Hopkins. She graduated from Northwestern University.

She is a daughter of Charlene and Dr. James F. King of Canton. Her father, a gastroenterologist, practices in Canton and is also a professor of internal medicine at the Northeastern Ohio Universities College of Medicine in Rootstown, Ohio.

Dr. Oliver, 35, is a research analyst for the international development program of the American Institutes for Research, a research and policy center in Washington; he conducts research on educational quality in Southern Africa. He graduated from Mary Washington College in Fredericksburg, Va., and received a master's degree in geography from Miami University of Ohio and a doctoral degree in educational policy from Ohio State University.

He is a son of Patricia and Arnold R. Oliver of Harborton, Va. His mother retired as an accounts manager at Engineering Design and Sales, a maker of electronic parts in Danville, Va. His father retired as the chancellor of the Virginia Community College System, which has its headquarters in Richmond, and is a professor of English at Eastern Shore Community College in Melfa, Va.
